title: `make all` fails with `make: *** No rule to make target 'install', needed by 'all'.  Stop.`

labels.name: status:confirmed
labels.description: Bug has been confirmed by the Streamlit team

labels.name: area:contribution
labels.description: Error in setting up development for Streamlit (or Contributing Wiki pages)

body:
### Checklist

- [x] I have searched the [existing issues](https://github.com/streamlit/streamlit/issues) for similar issues.
- [x] I added a very descriptive title to this issue.
- [x] I have provided sufficient information below to help reproduce this issue.

### Summary

Trying to run `make all` gets pretty dang far along, but eventually fails at this point with this error message:

```
static/media/fireworks.B4d-_KUe.gif
static/media/flake-0.DgWaVvm5.png
static/media/flake-1.B2r5AHMK.png
static/media/flake-2.BnWSExPC.png
static/media/snowflake.JU2jBHL8.svg

sent 22,860,594 bytes  received 3,066 bytes  4,157,029.09 bytes/sec
total size is 22,843,865  speedup is 1.00
# Move manifest.json to a location that can actually be served by the Tornado
# server's static asset handler.
mv lib/streamlit/static/.vite/manifest.json lib/streamlit/static
make: *** No rule to make target 'install', needed by 'all'.  Stop.
```

I agree with make. There doesn't appear to be a target named `install` in the makefile, even though all lists it as a target. [There used to be](https://github.com/streamlit/streamlit/blob/e912139a4bddf07dbee2cad48501cbfa92e31e0a/Makefile#L126), but there is not now.

<details>
  <summary>Incorrect information about an error I initially believed was related to this issue, but which I now believe was the result of a file permissions error in the venv; and now that I've resolved that (using `sudo chmod -R 777 .venv`), python-init installs the package fine.</summary>
  Also: streamlit didn't install. When I type `streamlit` on the command line I get `streamlit: command not found`, and when I type `python -m streamlit` I get `/usr/bin/python: No module named streamlit`. `uv run streamlit hello` gets `error: Failed to spawn: streamlit  Caused by: No such file or directory (os error 2)`. Edit: however, `cd lib;  uv run python -m streamlit` still works.
</details>

### Is this a regression?

- [x] Yes, this used to work in a previous version.

### Debug info

- Streamlit version: n/a, but I'm on the tip of develop, actually a couple commits past that (to fix another problem)
- Python version: Python 3.12.3
- Operating System: Windows 10, WSL2
- Browser: n/a
